newsitem.title: UK: BG makes N.Sea oil find, eyes development.
newsitem.headline: BG makes N.Sea oil find, eyes development.

text.p: BG plc said on Tuesday it had discovered oil in block 15/23d of the U.K. Continental Shelf (UKCS), 85 kilometres west of the BG-operated Armada fields in the northern North Sea.

BG Exploration and Production (BG E&P) said the high pressure discovery well, which completed testing last month, encountered flow rates in excess of 7,500 barrels per day (bpd) of oil and 9.0 million cubic feet per day (cfd) of associated gas on a 32/64 inch choke.
"We are delighted to announce this important discovery and have already begun conceptual studies so as to reduce the time to first production," said Frank Chapman, BG E&P's managing director.
"Discussions have started with adjacent field operators to evaluate the possibility of a fast track development," he added.
BG E&P is operator of Block 15/23d and holds a 60 percent stake. Agip (UK) Ltd holds the remaining 40 percent.
